member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions
member.summary: Specifies how the operating system should open a file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.None
member.summary: None of the options specified.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.Archive
member.summary: The file should be archived. Applications use this attribute to mark files for backup or removal.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.Encrypted
member.summary: The file or directory is encrypted. For a file, this means that all data in the file is encrypted. For a directory, this means that encryption is the default for newly created files and subdirectories.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.Hidden
member.summary: The file is hidden. Do not include it in an ordinary directory listing.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.Normal
member.summary: The file does not have other attributes set. This attribute is valid only if used alone.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.Offline
member.summary: The data of a file is not immediately available. This attribute indicates that file data is physically moved to offline storage. This attribute is used by Remote Storage, the hierarchical storage management software. Applications should not arbitrarily change this attribute.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.ReadOnly
member.summary: The file is read only. Applications can read the file, but cannot write to or delete it.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.System
member.summary: The file is part of or used exclusively by an operating system.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.Temporary
member.summary: The file is being used for temporary storage.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.BackupSemantics
member.summary: The file is being opened or created for a backup or restore operation. The system ensures that the calling process overrides file security checks when the process has SE_BACKUP_NAME and SE_RESTORE_NAME privileges. You must set this flag to obtain a handle to a directory. A directory handle can be passed to some functions instead of a file handle.

summary.para: The file is to be deleted immediately after all of its handles are closed, which includes the specified handle and any other open or duplicated handles.
If there are existing open handles to a file, the call fails unless they were all opened with the share mode.
Subsequent open requests for the file fail, unless the share mode is specified.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.NoBuffering
member.summary: There are strict requirements for successfully working with files opened with the flag, for details see the section on "File Buffering" in the online MSDN documentation.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.OpenNoRecall
member.summary: The file data is requested, but it should continue to be located in remote storage. It should not be transported back to local storage. This flag is for use by remote storage systems.

summary.para: Normal reparse point processing will not occur; an attempt to open the reparse point will be made. When a file is opened, a file handle is returned, whether or not the filter that controls the reparse point is operational. See MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.Overlapped
member.summary: The file or device is being opened or created for asynchronous I/O.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.PosixSemantics
member.summary: Access will occur according to POSIX rules. This includes allowing multiple files with names, differing only in case, for file systems that support that naming. Use care when using this option, because files created with this flag may not be accessible by applications that are written for MS-DOS or 16-bit Windows.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.RandomAccess
member.summary: Access is intended to be random. The system can use this as a hint to optimize file caching.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.SequentialScan
member.summary: Access is intended to be sequential from beginning to end. The system can use this as a hint to optimize file caching.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileOptions.WriteThrough
member.summary: Write operations will not go through any intermediate cache, they will go directly to disk.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the state of the object.
member.remarks: FileSystemInfo.Refresh takes a snapshot of the file from the current file system. Refresh cannot correct the underlying file system even if the file system returns incorrect or outdated information. This can happen on platforms such as Windows 98. Calls must be made to Refresh before attempting to get the attribute information, or the information will be outdated.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.LastAccessTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time the current file or directory was last accessed.
member.remarks: When first called, calls Refresh and returns the cached information on APIs to get attributes and so on. On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information. If the file described in the object does not exist, this property will return 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), adjusted to local time.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.LastAccessTimeUtc
member.summary: Gets or sets the time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), that the current file or directory was last accessed
member.remarks: When first called, calls Refresh and returns the cached information on APIs to get attributes and so on. On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information. If the file described in the object does not exist, this property will return 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), adjusted to local time.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.LastWriteTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time when the current file or directory was last written to.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.LastWriteTimeUtc
member.summary: Gets or sets the time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), when the current file or directory was last written to.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.Name
member.summary: For files, gets the name of the file. For directories, gets the name of the last directory in the hierarchy if a hierarchy exists. Otherwise, the Name property gets the name of the directory.
member.remarks: For a directory, Name returns only the name of the parent directory, such as Dir, not c:\Dir. For a subdirectory, Name returns only the name of the subdirectory, such as Sub1, not c:\Dir\Sub1. For a file, Name returns only the file name and file name extension, such as MyFile.txt, not c:\Dir\Myfile.txt.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.PathInfo.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class specifying whether wildcards should be accepted or not.
member.param: The path.
if set to true wildcards are allowed in the file name part of the path. If set to false, wildcards are not allowed and an will be thrown if they are present.

remarks.para: Note that under no circumstances will this class accept wildcards in the directory part of the path, only in the file-name, i.e. the component after the last backslash or separator.

Extended length unicode paths (also referred to as long paths) (those starting with \\?\) will not be parsed for wildcards etc., regardless of the setting of this parameter. In such a path any character is valid and backslashes alone are considered to be separators.

The indices.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.PathInfo.GetLongPath
member.summary: Retrieves the full long (or extended) unicode version of the path represented by this instance.

remarks.para: This method takes care of different path conversions to be usable in Unicode variants of the Win32 funcitons (which are internally used throughout AlphaFS).

Regular paths are changed like the following:
C:\Somewhere\Something.txt \\?\C:\Somewhere\Something.txt
\\Somewhere\Something.txt \\?\UNC\Somewhere\Something.txt
Already processed paths are preserved untouched so to avoid mistakes of double prefixing.
If the path represented by this instance is not an absolute path, or is not rooted, the path of the current directory (and drive) is combined with this path to form an absolute path.

member.returns: The long or extended unicode version of the specified path.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.PathInfo.GetFullPath
member.summary: Gets the full absolute path of the path represented by this instance. This is done by "applying" the path to the current directory if the path does not contain a root, or the volume of the current directory if the path does not contain any drive information.
member.returns: The full absolute path.

member.summary: Gets a structure. For a file, the structure specifies the last time that a file is read from or written to. For a directory, the structure specifies when the directory is created. For both files and directories, the specified date is correct, but the time of day is always set to midnight. If the underlying file system does not support the last access time, this member is zero (0).
member.value: A structure that specified when a file was last written to or the directory created.

member.value: A structure that specified when a file was last written to or the directory created.

member.summary: Refreshes the state of the object.
member.remarks: FileSystemInfo.Refresh takes a snapshot of the file from the current file system. Refresh cannot correct the underlying file system even if the file system returns incorrect or outdated information. This can happen on platforms such as Windows 98. Calls must be made to Refresh before attempting to get the attribute information, or the information will be outdated.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryInfo.GetDirectories
member.summary: Returns the subdirectories of the current directory.
member.returns: An array of DirectoryInfo objects.
member.remarks: If there are no subdirectories, this method returns an empty array. This method is not recursive.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryInfo.GetDirectories(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an array of directories in the current DirectoryInfo matching the given search criteria.
member.param: The search string, such as "System*", used to search for all directories beginning with the word "System".
member.returns: An array of type DirectoryInfo matching searchPattern.
member.remarks: Wildcards are permitted. For example, the searchPattern string "*t" searches for all directory names in path ending with the letter "t". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all directory names in path beginning with the letter "s". The string ".." can only be used in searchPattern if it is specified as a part of a valid directory name, such as in the directory name "a..b". It cannot be used to move up the directory hierarchy. If there are no subdirectories, or no subdirectories match the searchPattern parameter, this method returns an empty array. For a list of common I/O tasks, see Common I/O Tasks.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryInfo.GetDirectories(System.String,System.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Returns an array of directories in the current DirectoryInfo matching the given search criteria and using a value to determine whether to search subdirectories.
member.param: The search string, such as "System*", used to search for all directories beginning with the word "System".
One of the values of the SearchOption enumeration that specifies whether the search operation should include only the current directory or should include all subdirectories.
member.returns: An array of type DirectoryInfo matching searchPattern.
member.remarks: Wildcards are permitted. For example, the searchPattern string "*t" searches for all directory names in path ending with the letter "t". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all directory names in path beginning with the letter "s". The string ".." can only be used in searchPattern if it is specified as a part of a valid directory name, such as in the directory name "a..b". It cannot be used to move up the directory hierarchy. If there are no subdirectories, or no subdirectories match the searchPattern parameter, this method returns an empty array. For a list of common I/O tasks, see Common I/O Tasks.

member.returns: An array of type FileInfo.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryInfo.GetFiles(System.String,System.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Returns a file list from the current directory matching the given searchPattern and using a value to determine whether to search subdirectories.
member.param: The search string, such as "System*", used to search for all directories beginning with the word "System".
One of the values of the SearchOption enumeration that specifies whether the search operation should include only the current directory or should include all subdirectories.
member.returns: An array of type FileInfo.
member.remarks: The following wildcard specifiers are permitted in searchPattern: "*" and "?". The order of the returned file names is not guaranteed; use the Sort()()() method if a specific sort order is required. Wildcards are permitted. For example, the searchPattern string "*.txt" searches for all file names having an extension of "txt". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all file names beginning with the letter "s". If there are no files, or no files that match the searchPattern string in the DirectoryInfo, this method returns an empty array.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryInfo.GetFileSystemInfos
member.summary: Returns an array of strongly typed FileSystemInfo entries representing all the files and subdirectories in a directory.
member.returns: An array of strongly typed FileSystemInfo entries.
member.remarks: This method is not recursive. For subdirectories, the FileSystemInfo objects returned by this method can be cast to the derived class DirectoryInfo. Use the FileAttributes value returned by the FileSystemInfo.Attributes property to determine whether the FileSystemInfo represents a file or a directory. Wild cards are permitted. For example, the searchPattern string "*t" searches for all directory names in path ending with the letter "t". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all directory names in path beginning with the letter "s". The string ".." can only be used in searchPattern if it is specified as a part of a valid directory name, such as in the directory name "a..b". It cannot be used to move up the directory hierarchy. If there are no files or directories, or no files or directories that match the searchPattern string in the DirectoryInfo, this method returns an empty array. For a list of common I/O tasks, see Common I/O Tasks.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryInfo.GetFileSystemInfos(System.String)

member.returns: An array of strongly typed FileSystemInfo objects matching the search criteria.
member.remarks: This method is not recursive. For subdirectories, the FileSystemInfo objects returned by this method can be cast to the derived class DirectoryInfo. Use the FileAttributes value returned by the FileSystemInfo.Attributes property to determine whether the FileSystemInfo represents a file or a directory. Wild cards are permitted. For example, the searchPattern string "*t" searches for all directory names in path ending with the letter "t". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all directory names in path beginning with the letter "s". The string ".." can only be used in searchPattern if it is specified as a part of a valid directory name, such as in the directory name "a..b". It cannot be used to move up the directory hierarchy. If there are no files or directories, or no files or directories that match the searchPattern string in the DirectoryInfo, this method returns an empty array. For a list of common I/O tasks, see Common I/O Tasks.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryInfo.MoveTo(System.String)
member.summary: Moves a DirectoryInfo instance and its contents to a new path.
member.param: The name and path to which to move this directory. The destination cannot be directory with the identical name. It can be an existing directory to which you want to add this directory as a subdirectory.
member.remarks: This method throws an IOException if, for example, you try to move c:\mydir to c:\public, and c:\public already exists. You must specify "c:\\public\\mydir" as the destDirName parameter, or specify a new directory name such as "c:\\newdir". This method permits moving a directory to a read-only directory. The read/write attribute of neither directory is affected. For a list of common I/O tasks, see Common I/O Tasks.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Volume.SetVolumeMountPoint(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Mounts the specified volume at the specified volume mount point.
member.param: The volume mount point where the volume is to be mounted. This may be a root directory (X:\) or a directory on a volume (X:\mnt\). The string must end with a trailing backslash ('\').

The volume to be mounted. This string must be a unique volume name of the form "\\?\Volume{GUID}\" where GUID is a GUID that identifies the volume. The \\?\ turns off path parsing and is ignored as part of the path. For example, "\\?\C:\myworld\private" is seen as "C:\myworld\private".

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Volume.DeleteVolumeMountPoint(System.String)
member.summary: Unmounts the volume from the specified volume mount point.
member.param: The volume mount point to be unmounted. This may be a root directory (X:\, in which case the DOS drive letter assignment is removed) or a directory on a volume (X:\mnt\). A trailing backslash is required.
member.remarks: It is not an error to attempt to unmount a volume from a volume mount point when there is no volume actually mounted at that volume mount point.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Volume.DefineDosDevice(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Defines or redefines MS-DOS device names.
member.param: A MS-DOS path string that will implement this device.

An MS-DOS device name string specifying the device the function is defining or redefining. The device name string must not have a trailing colon, unless a drive letter (C or D, for example) is being defined or redefined. In no case is a trailing backslash allowed.
member.returns: true upon success, or false otherwise.
member.remarks: Call Marshal.GetLastWin32Error() to receive additional error information if this method fails.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Volume.DeleteDosDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes an MS-DOS device name.
member.param: An MS-DOS device name string specifying the device the function is deleting. The device name string must not have a trailing colon, unless a drive letter (C or D, for example) is being deleted. In no case is a trailing backslash allowed.
member.returns: true upon success, or false otherwise.
member.remarks: Call Marshal.GetLastWin32Error() to receive additional error information if this method fails.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Volume.QueryDosDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves information about MS-DOS device names. The function can obtain the current mapping for a particular MS-DOS device name. The function can also obtain a list of all existing MS-DOS device names.
member.param: The device.
member.returns: An MS-DOS device name string specifying the target of the query. The device name cannot have a trailing backslash. This parameter can be . In that case, the QueryDosDevice function will return an array of all existing MS-DOS device names
member.remarks: See documentation on MSDN for the Windows QueryDosDevice() method for more information.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Volume.QueryAllDosDevices
member.summary: Retreives a list of all existing MS-DOS device names.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to calling QueryDosDevice(null)

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Volume.GetDiskFreeSpace(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the amount of space that is available on a disk volume, which is the total amount of space, the total amount of free space, and the total amount of free space available to the user that is associated with the calling thread.
member.param:
A directory on the disk. If this parameter is NULL, the function uses the root of the current disk. If this parameter is a UNC name, it must include a trailing backslash, for example, "\\MyServer\MyShare\". This parameter does not have to specify the root directory on a disk. The function accepts any directory on a disk.
The calling application must have FILE_LIST_DIRECTORY access rights for this directory.
member.returns: A object containing the requested information.

member.summary: The move options for a file move operation.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveFileOptions.ReplaceExisting
member.summary: If the destination file name already exists, the function replaces its contents with the contents of the source file.
member.remark: This value cannot be used if either source or destination names a directory.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveFileOptions.CopyAllowed
member.summary: If the file is to be moved to a different volume, the function simulates the move by using the CopyFile and DeleteFile functions.
member.remarks: This value cannot be used with .

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveFileOptions.DelayUntilReboot

summary.para: The system does not move the file until the operating system is restarted. The system moves the file immediately after AUTOCHK is executed, but before creating any paging files. Consequently, this parameter enables the function to delete paging files from previous startups.
This value can only be used if the process is in the context of a user who belongs to the administrators group or the LocalSystem account.

member.remarks: This value cannot be used with .

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveFileOptions.WriteThrough

summary.para: The function does not return until the file has actually been moved on the disk.
Setting this value guarantees that a move performed as a copy and delete operation is flushed to disk before the function returns. The flush occurs at the end of the copy operation.

member.remarks: This value has no effect if is set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveFileOptions.CreateHardlink
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveFileOptions.FailIfNotTrackable
member.summary: The function fails if the source file is a link source, but the file cannot be tracked after the move. This situation can occur if the destination is a volume formatted with the FAT file system.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.ListDirectory
member.summary: Specifies the right to read the contents of a directory.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.WriteData
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and write to a file or folder. This does not include the right to open and write file system attributes, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.CreateFiles
member.summary: Specifies the right to create a file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.AppendData
member.summary: Specifies the right to append data to the end of a file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.CreateDirectories
member.summary: Specifies the right to create a folder.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.ReadExtendedAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy extended file system attributes from a folder or file. For example, this value specifies the right to view author and content information. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.WriteExtendedAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and write extended file system attributes to a folder or file. This does not include the ability to write data, attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.ExecuteFile
member.summary: Specifies the right to run an application file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.Traverse
member.summary: Specifies the right to list the contents of a folder and to run applications contained within that folder.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.DeleteSubdirectoriesAndFiles
member.summary: Specifies the right to delete a folder and any files contained within that folder.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.ReadAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy file system attributes from a folder or file. For example, this value specifies the right to view the file creation or modified date. This does not include the right to read data, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.WriteAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and write file system attributes to a folder or file. This does not include the ability to write data, extended attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.Delete
member.summary: Specifies the right to delete a folder or file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.ReadPermissions
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy access and audit rules from a folder or file. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, and extended file system attributes.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.ChangePermissions
member.summary: Specifies the right to change the security and audit rules associated with a file or folder.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.TakeOwnership
member.summary: Specifies the right to change the owner of a folder or file. Note that owners of a resource have full access to that resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemRights.Synchronize

member.remarks: This class uses the BackupRead, BackupSeek and BackupWrite functions from the Win32 API to provide access to the file or directory.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.BackupFileStream.Skip(System.Int64)
member.summary: Skips ahead the specified number of bytes from the current stream.

remarks.para: This method represents the Win32 API implementation of BackupSeek.

Applications use the method to skip portions of a data stream that cause errors. This function does not seek across stream headers. For example, this function cannot be used to skip the stream name. If an application attempts to seek past the end of a substream, the function fails, the return value indicates the actual number of bytes the function seeks, and the file position is placed at the start of the next stream header.

member.param: The number of bytes to skip.
member.returns: The number of bytes actually skipped.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

note.para: This stream does not support seeking using this method, and calling this method will always throw . See for an alternative way of seeking forward.

member.exception: The stream does not support seeking.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.File
member.summary: Provides static methods for the creation, copying, deletion, moving, and opening of files, and aids in the creation of objects. As opposed to the corresponding class, this class supports the use of extended length unicode paths, such as \\?\Volume{c00fa7c5-63eb-11dd-b6ed-806e6f6e6963}\autoexec.bat. In addition, support for transacted file operation using the kernel transaction manager is provided. (See also ).
member.remarks: Note that no methods in this class perform any validation of the supplied paths. They are passed as is to the corresponding native kernel functions, meaning that invalid paths may result in exceptions of a type other than the expected for a certain operation.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.File.GetCompressedSize(System.String)
member.overloads: Retrieves the actual number of bytes of disk storage used to store a specified file.
member.summary: Retrieves the actual number of bytes of disk storage used to store a specified file.
member.remarks: If the file is located on a volume that supports compression and the file is compressed, the value obtained is the compressed size of the specified file. If the file is located on a volume that supports sparse files and the file is a sparse file, the value obtained is the sparse size of the specified file.

param.name: fileName
param.para: The name of the file.
Do not specify the name of a file on a nonseeking device, such as a pipe or a communications device, as its file size has no meaning.

member.returns: the actual number of bytes of disk storage used to store the specified file.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.File.GetCompressedSize(Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.KernelTransaction,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the actual number of bytes of disk storage used to store a specified file as part of a transaction. If the file is located on a volume that supports compression and the file is compressed, the value obtained is the compressed size of the specified file. If the file is located on a volume that supports sparse files and the file is a sparse file, the value obtained is the sparse size of the specified file.
member.param: The transaction.

param.name: fileName
param.para: The name of the file.
Do not specify the name of a file on a nonseeking device, such as a pipe or a communications device, as its file size has no meaning.

member.returns: the actual number of bytes of disk storage used to store the specified file.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege
member.summary: Represents a privilege for an access token. The privileges available on the local machine are available as static instances from this class. To create a representing a privilege on another system, use the constructor specifying a system name together with one of these static instances.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.AssignPrimaryToken
member.summary: Required to assign the primary token of a process. User Right: Replace a process-level token.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Audit
member.summary: Required to generate audit-log entries. Give this privilege to secure servers. User Right: Generate security audits.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Backup
member.summary: Required to perform backup operations. This privilege causes the system to grant all read access control to any file, regardless of the access control list (ACL) specified for the file. Any access request other than read is still evaluated with the ACL. User Right: Back up files and directories.

member.summary: Refreshes the state of the object.

Refresh cannot correct the underlying file system even if the file system returns incorrect or outdated information. This can happen on platforms such as Windows 98. member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileInfo.Decrypt
member.summary: Decrypts a file that was encrypted by the current account using the method.
member.remarks: The Decrypt method allows you to decrypt a file that was encrypted using the Encrypt method. The Decrypt method can decrypt only files that were encrypted using the current user account. Both the Encrypt method and the Decrypt method use the cryptographic service provider (CSP) installed on the computer and the file encryption keys of the process calling the method. The current file system must be formatted as NTFS and the current operating system must be Microsoft Windows NT or later.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileInfo.Encrypt
member.summary: Encrypts a file so that only the account used to encrypt the file can decrypt it.
member.remarks: The Encrypt method allows you to encrypt a file so that only the account used to call this method can decrypt it. Use the Decrypt method to decrypt a file encrypted by the Encrypt method. Both the Encrypt method and the Decrypt method use the cryptographic service provider (CSP) installed on the computer and the file encryption keys of the process calling the method. The current file system must be formatted as NTFS and the current operating system must be Microsoft Windows NT or later.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Path.GetLongPath(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the full long (or extended) unicode version of the specified .

remarks.para: This method takes care of different path conversions to be usable in Unicode variants of the Win32 funcitons (which are internally used throughout AlphaFS).

Regular paths are changed like the following:
C:\Somewhere\Something.txt \\?\C:\Somewhere\Something.txt
\\Somewhere\Something.txt \\?\UNC\Somewhere\Something.txt
Already processed paths are preserved untouched so to avoid mistakes of double prefixing.
If the is not an absolute path, or is not rooted, the path of the current directory (and drive) is combined with the specified to form an absolute path.

member.param: File or Folder name to sanitize and prefix with proper standard.
member.returns: The full long (or extended) unicode version of the specified .

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Path.GetRegularPath(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the regular path from long prefixed one. i.e. \\?\C:\Temp\file.txt to C:\Temp\file.txt \\?\UNC\Server\share\file.txt to \\Server\share\file.txt
member.param: The path.
member.returns: Regular form path string.
member.remarks: This method does not handle paths with volume names, eg. \\?\Volume{c00fa7c5-63eb-11dd-b6ed-806e6f6e6963}\Folder\file.txt

summary.para: Contains constants for controlling the kind of access other FileStream objects can have to the same file.
This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileShare.None
member.summary: Declines sharing of the current file. Any request to open the file (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileShare.Read
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for reading. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for reading (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileShare.Write
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for writing. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for writing (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileShare.ReadWrite
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for reading or writing. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for reading or writing (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileShare.Delete
member.summary: Allows subsequent deleting of a file.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileIdBothDirectoryInfo.EndOfFile
member.summary: The absolute new end-of-file position as a byte offset from the start of the file to the end of the file. Because this value is zero-based, it actually refers to the first free byte in the file. In other words, EndOfFile is the offset to the byte that immediately follows the last valid byte in the file.

member.summary: The file or directory is an archive file or directory. Applications use this attribute to mark files for backup or removal.

summary.para: The file or directory is compressed.
For a file, this means that all of the data in the file is compressed.
For a directory, this means that compression is the default for newly created files and subdirectories.

member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileAttributes.Directory
member.summary: The handle identifies a directory.

summary.para: The file or directory is encrypted.
For a file, this means that all data in the file is encrypted.
For a directory, this means that encryption is the default for newly created files and subdirectories.

member.summary: The file or directory is hidden. It is not included in an ordinary directory listing.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileAttributes.Normal
member.summary: The file or directory does not have other attributes set. This attribute is valid only when used alone.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileAttributes.NotContentIndexed
member.summary: The file is not to be indexed by the content indexing service.

summary.para: The file data is not available immediately.
This attribute indicates that the file data is physically moved to offline storage.
This attribute is used by Remote Storage, which is the hierarchical storage management software.
Note Applications should not arbitrarily change this attribute.
The file or directory is read-only.
For a file, applications can read the file, but cannot write to it or delete it.
For a directory, applications cannot delete it.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Directory
member.summary: Exposes static methods for creating, moving, and enumerating through directories and subdirectories.

remarks.para: As opposed to this class supports the use of extenden length unicode paths, such as \\?\Volume{c00fa7c5-63eb-11dd-b6ed-806e6f6e6963}\Program Files\Internet Explorer. In addition, support for transacted file operation using the kernel transaction manager is provided. (See also ).

Note that no methods in this class perform any validation of the supplied paths. They are passed as is to the corresponding native kernel functions, meaning that invalid paths may result in exceptions of a type other than the expected for a certain operation.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Directory.GetProperties(Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.KernelTransaction,System.String,System.IO.SearchOption,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Gets the properties of the particular folder without following any symbolic links or mount points. Properties include aggregated info from of each encountered file system object. Plus additional ones: Total, File, Size, Error
Total: is the total number of enumerated objects.
File: is the total number of files. File is considered when object is neither nor .
Size: is the total size of enumerated objects.
Error: is the total number of errors encountered during request.
member.remarks: Directory: is an object which has attribute without one.
member.param: The transaction. For a non transacted operation pass NULL.
The target directory.
The search option. Either top level or subfolders too.
if set to true continue on errors.
member.returns: A dictionary mapping the keys mentioned above to their respective aggregated values.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Directory.GetFileIdBothDirectoryInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves information about files in the directory specified by .

remarks.para: No specific access rights is required to query this information.

File reference numbers, also called file IDs, are guaranteed to be unique only within a static file system. They are not guaranteed to be unique over time, because file systems are free to reuse them. Nor are they guaranteed to remain constant. For example, the FAT file system generates the file reference number for a file from the byte offset of the file's directory entry record (DIRENT) on the disk. Defragmentation can change this byte offset. Thus a FAT file reference number can change over time.

para.b: Requires Windows Vista or Windows Server 2008 or later.

member.param: A path to a directory from which to retrieve information.
member.returns: An enumeration of records for each file system entry in the specified diretory.
